item.title: Git Commands
item.description:
–tags: Useful –references: https://learngitbranching.js.org/

Commands

  • git add : tracking with git

  • git status : current status of tracked, untracked, changed, committed files.

  • git add filename.extension

(only after making the file it can be done)

  • double add command - stages the new changes

  • git commit

  • git add . -> all files are committed

  • git add *.html ->only html files are committed

  • touch .gitignore

  • git branch Mybranch

  • git commit -m ‘commit command’

  • git checkout master

item.title: Emacs Shortcuts
item.description:
Emacs Shortcuts

  1. Spc f d –> search for files in dired
  2. Spc : –> main command
  3. Spc g s –> git status
  4. Spc n n –> Capture template
  5. Spc n a –> agenda view
  6. Vim commands
    1. Ctrl up , down –> go up and down in file
    2. q [a-z] –> record a macro
    3. Shift » –> indent in code
  7. Evil snipe:
    1. s ch : go to ch ; same as f but more letters
    2. gc : to comment using evil
    3. gs [annotation] –> to go to lines directly like vimium ease
    4. dii –> delete inside indentation
    5. dik –> delete inside plus a line above
  8. Dired buffer shortcuts:
    1. Dired marking and unmarking options: % and * keys
    2. Narrow subtree : (
    3. Show git status for files : )
    4. Diff one file to another: =
    5. Create a directory : +
    6. Up a directory : -
    7. Rename a file: R
    8. Change timestamp of file: T
    9. Copy filename: Y
    10. Open a sub-directory in same menu: I
    11. Change ownership of file: O
    12. Unmark all files: U
    13. Hardlink of file: H
    14. Goto file: J
    15. Counsel search online: K
    16. Encrypt, decrypt a file: ;
    17. Uncompress or compress : Z
    18. Copy file to : C
    19. Byte compile a file: B
    20. Change file mode: M
    21. Copy async to rsync : C-c C-r
    22. Wide dired mode: i
  9. Org table by copying html table: C-c |
  10. Show all project TODOs: Spc p t
  11. Scroll other window : S-up
  12. Scroll other window down : S-down

Backlinks

  • Emacs Hugo Blogging

item.title: Emacs Completion
item.description:
Vim’s omni like completion

Keybind Description C-x C-] Complete etags C-x C-f Complete file path C-x C-k Complete from dictionary/keyword C-x C-l Complete full line C-x C-o Invoke complete-at-point function C-x C-n Complete next symbol at point C-x C-p Complete previous symbol at point C-x C-s Complete snippet C-x s Complete spelling suggestions

item.title: Numpy
item.description:
Working with numpy:

  • import numpy as np

  • a = np.array([0,1,2])

  • a.ndim - gives dimension of array

  • a.shape : gives the shape of the array

  • a.reshape((3,2)) new order of matrix to be formed

    • changing a element of an array we reshaped is also going to change from the original since numpy package avoids copies

  • so if copy needed: c= a.reshape((3,2)).copy()

  • Contrast to general array operations:

    • a*2 multiplies each element by 2

    • alok >4

item.title: Linux Tip
item.description:
Additional features that come in handy:

Bashrc : Notify when command completes

control + a for getting to the start of the line and control + e to get to the end of the line

sudo !! for last command with sudo priveleges

last command with !$

yes | command_script_anything : for having not to say yes every time to a script

filename : empty the contents of the file without deleting it or opening it

item.title: Python
item.description: – iteration: -! specific no of times: range(5) -! as long as the variable : for ch in “Hello” – querying the directory of the module for objects to use: e.g. import random dir(random) – asking for help with the object we searched: help(random.randint) – sleep function: import time time.sleep(5) – Know that everything is an object in python – Built in data structures: list, dictionary, tuple and sets -! lists are dynamic and mutable too. -! methods: append() , len(list_name), remove(item_name),pop(index),pop()-last element removed -! methods: extend([3,4]),insert(index,item),pop() returns the removed value -! copying using assignment is not actual. it just points to the same thing. first = [1,2,4] second = first first.append(5)

Ctrl+a

php -r 'function a(){$i=10;while($i--)echo str_repeat(" ",rand(1,79))."*".PHP_EOL;}$i=99;while($i--){a();echo str_repeat(" ",34)."Happy New Year 2011".PHP_EOL;a();usleep(200000);}'

ecking if existing session is createdalias irssi="screen -wipe; screen -A -U -x -R -S irssi irssi"

:exe getline(1)[1:] @%

ruler() { for s in '....^....|' '1234567890'; do w=${#s}; str=''; for (( i=1; i<=(COLUMNS + w) / $w; i=i+1 )); do str+=$s; done; str=${str:0:COLUMNS} ; echo $str; done; }

item.title: Photoshop
item.description:
Photoshop carefulness:

  • Active layer is to be cared.

  • Not on bed or something

  • control +g go back

  • move tool by pressing V

  • always group layers and rename them

  • control g for group after selecting using control

    Never use yellow background with white text Designing a cursor to appear on the design . Selecting a hover to other text color and also the opacity to change either low or high
